Package main

Class SoundEffect

java.lang.Object
main.SoundEffect
public class SoundEffect
extends java.lang.Object
The SoundEffect class allows a simple and easy interface to use when loading, playing, or looping sound effects.
Author:
Harry Felton

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private long bufferLength
    The length of the data buffer for this sound effect
    private byte[] data
    The audio data that makes up the sound effect
    private float decibelVolume
    The volume that should be used when playing this sound effect; can be set manually, or overridden when giving the play command
    private javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat format
    Format of the sound effect
    private javax.sound.sampled.Clip mLoopClip
    Loop Clip - usually null unless the clip is played in a looped fashion, in which case this is populated with a Clip (from AudioSystem.getClip) which is loaded with this sound effect and told to loop.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Modifier Constructor Description
    protected SoundEffect​(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream stream)
    Constructs a new sound effect based on the provided input stream

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private javax.sound.sampled.Clip generateClip​(float volume)
    A private method used to simplify the play(Once/Loop) methods.
    javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getAudioFormat()
    Get the audio format this sound effect is specified in
    long getBufferSize()
    Get the length of the data buffer currently occupying the data field.
    byte[] getData()
    Fetch the byte array of data that specifies this audio
    float getDecibelVolume()
    Returns the volume (in decibels) that this audio clip will be played at unless a different volume is specified when giving the play command
    javax.sound.sampled.Clip getLoopClip()
    Gets the loop clip to use, if any exists
    static SoundEffect loadSoundEffect​(java.lang.String path)
    Loads the sound effect by opening an audio stream at the path provided, and loading the audio data in to a SoundEffect instance.
    void playLoop()
    Loops the sound effect at the default volume specified by decibelVolume
    void playLoop​(float volume)
    Loops the sound effect at the volume provided
    void playOnce()
    Plays this sound effect once with the default volume specified by decibelVolume
    void playOnce​(float volume)
    Plays this sound effect once using the volume provided
    void setDecibelVolume​(float decibelVolume)
    Sets the volume used when playing this audio clip, unless a different value is given when playing the sound clip.
    void setLoopClip​(javax.sound.sampled.Clip clip)
    Sets the clip to use when looping this sound effect
    void stopLoop()
    Stops looping this audio if it's currently looping.

  • Field Details

    • format

      private final javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat format
      Format of the sound effect

    • data

      private final byte[] data
      The audio data that makes up the sound effect

    • bufferLength

      private final long bufferLength
      The length of the data buffer for this sound effect
      See Also:
      data

    • decibelVolume

      private float decibelVolume
      The volume that should be used when playing this sound effect; can be set manually, or overridden when giving the play command
      See Also:
      setDecibelVolume(float), playLoop(float), playOnce(float)

    • mLoopClip

      private javax.sound.sampled.Clip mLoopClip
      Loop Clip - usually null unless the clip is played in a looped fashion, in which case this is populated with a Clip (from AudioSystem.getClip) which is loaded with this sound effect and told to loop.

  • Constructor Details

    • SoundEffect

      protected SoundEffect​(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream stream)
      Constructs a new sound effect based on the provided input stream
      Parameters:
      stream - The stream to use

  • Method Details

    • getLoopClip

      public javax.sound.sampled.Clip getLoopClip()
      Gets the loop clip to use, if any exists
      Returns:
      The Clip to loop, or null if none generated yet

    • setLoopClip

      public void setLoopClip​(javax.sound.sampled.Clip clip)
      Sets the clip to use when looping this sound effect
      Parameters:
      clip - The AudioSystem Clip to loop

    • getDecibelVolume

      public float getDecibelVolume()
      Returns the volume (in decibels) that this audio clip will be played at unless a different volume is specified when giving the play command
      Returns:
      The default decibel volume
      See Also:
      playOnce(float), playLoop(float)

    • setDecibelVolume

      public void setDecibelVolume​(float decibelVolume)
      Sets the volume used when playing this audio clip, unless a different value is given when playing the sound clip.
      Parameters:
      decibelVolume - The volume (decibels) to play this clip at unless specified otherwise
      See Also:
      playLoop(float), playOnce(float)

    • getAudioFormat

      public javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getAudioFormat()
      Get the audio format this sound effect is specified in
      Returns:
      The audio format

    • getData

      public byte[] getData()
      Fetch the byte array of data that specifies this audio
      Returns:
      Data array

    • getBufferSize

      public long getBufferSize()
      Get the length of the data buffer currently occupying the data field.
      Returns:
      The length of the data array

    • generateClip

      private javax.sound.sampled.Clip generateClip​(float volume) throws SoundEffectException
      A private method used to simplify the play(Once/Loop) methods. This method will create an AudioSystem clip, based on the stream currently loaded and the volume provided to this method.
      Parameters:
      volume - The volume (decibels) to play this clip at
      Returns:
      The clip to be played
      Throws:
      SoundEffectException - Thrown if an exception occurs when creating the Clip.

    • playOnce

      public void playOnce​(float volume)
      Plays this sound effect once using the volume provided
      Parameters:
      volume - The volume (decibels) to play at

    • playOnce

      public void playOnce()
      Plays this sound effect once with the default volume specified by decibelVolume
      See Also:
      decibelVolume

    • playLoop

      public void playLoop​(float volume) throws SoundEffectException
      Loops the sound effect at the volume provided
      Parameters:
      volume - The decibel volume to play at
      Throws:
      SoundEffectException - Thrown when a failure occurs during the creation of the audio clip

    • playLoop

      public void playLoop() throws SoundEffectException
      Loops the sound effect at the default volume specified by decibelVolume
      Throws:
      SoundEffectException - Thrown if the playLoop(float) method throws this exception.
      See Also:
      decibelVolume, playOnce(float)

    • stopLoop

      public void stopLoop()
      Stops looping this audio if it's currently looping.
      See Also:
      mLoopClip

    • loadSoundEffect

      public static SoundEffect loadSoundEffect​(java.lang.String path)
      Loads the sound effect by opening an audio stream at the path provided, and loading the audio data in to a SoundEffect instance.
      Parameters:
      path - The file to load the audio from
      Returns:
      The SoundEffect instance used to play/loop this audio
